intro: Gochnatia berteroana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is native to Central and South America and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. It has a woody stem and can grow up to several meters tall, making it a notable species in its native habitats. Gochnatia berteroana is also known for its potential medicinal uses in traditional practices.
